I think the main point is that Shift4 is
a company that many ISO's and VAR's
rely on for a lot of things that they would
find hard to replace. FD isn't just in a
position that poses a threat to that model
because they're a massive processor. It's
that they also have a competing product
that many ISO and VARs find inferior. This
is a dangerous precedent for any company
partnering with another company that
offers even a partially competing product. @

POSTED: ‎01-03-2019 09:27 AM

In my opinion, the crucial point is that Shift4
offers companies and VAR's
a solution to get pretty much everything,
and they find it hard to get all the
from only one company. The First data possess a threat to that model
they're a giant processor. Additionally,
they also sell a similar product
that most ISO and VARs mark as average. This
situation is dangerous, especially when a company
has partnership with another one, which produces
slightly competing product.

Many VAR's use CardConnect's gateway, along with Datacap's
software, to process EMV. I would imagine that Fiserv/First Data
will probably terminate that relationship, or find a way to make those
relationships more difficult, due to the competitive nature.

payment agnostic and continue to support all processors.
